result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

3:02 pm case called. Defendant Troy A. Spann in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Troy A. Spann.  Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. 
There is an offer from the State but the Defense would like to counter offer and requests another status conference. The State is open to another status. 
A status conference is scheduled for 11/18/22 at 9:30 am (in person).

Defendant Troy A. Spann in court with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson.  Attorney Robert Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has reviewed the Information and enters pleas of Not Guilty to all the counts and requests 30 days for motions.  Not Guilty pleas received by the Court and 30 days granted for motions.
